revised_title: Extensions and Applications of the Calculus of Symbols
tldr: This paper continues the author's previous work on the calculus of symbols, focusing on extending the method for resolving functions of non-commutative symbols into binomial factors. It also explores methods for finding the highest common internal divisor of two functions, multiplying linear factors, and expanding the binomial theorem. The author hopes that the proofs and applications in this paper will demonstrate the unique nature of symbolic algebra.
